title: Is K-pop fake? Can the idols really be who they claim to be? - Quora

response.answer_text: I listen to Korean music and seldom venture into the kpop waters because I’m a 41 year old man but I have sampled a few. I have a few tracks in my library that could be categorised as “kpop” (Red Flavor” and “cheer up”, to name 2) but only the ones that really “call out” to me. Personally, I don’t think kpop is fake, to a certain extent. It’s manufactured, yes that much I’ll say. I believe the sitters of the songs are taught exactly how to sing each note of each song exactly the way the composers want it to sound. I think the singers can sing naturally but I think they’re coached to sing the songs they sing. Everything is choreographed and rehearsed just so everything is perfect. I have own wondered how kpop artists sound when they ad lib or perform acoustic sets. Solji of EXID can sing (as I’ve seen on her YouTube page), but she was a vocal coach before she became an idol. I can’t think of many others who could fit that bill. To sum up, are they fake? No, I don’t think so. Unless you ask them to sing “live” (without lip syncing), then that no might become a maybe.
